website_summaries.verdict: An advanced toaster that gives you precise control over the browning of your toast and enables you to monitor its progress throughout.
pros: Motorized carriage with Lift and Look button enables you to check on the progress of your toast without canceling the cycle
A Bit More, bagel and defrost settings
Extra long slots hold all types of bread
cons: Some users have complained of mechanical issues after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: 5 years—still going
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster back in 2015. It seemed like a good buy, but there were enough bad reviews that I was nervous (especially given the cost). It is now 2020 and it is still working well. I can tell I have lost a couple of heating elements, but the toaster is still making good toast! If it lasts another couple of years then it will have been worth every penny. And yes — the text for the start button has rubbed off. The other text hasn’t vanished. (I thought people were exaggerating, but I did end up being pretty annoyed about the loss of that start button text!)
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Toaster Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love to eat Egg Bread and Rye Bread. Both breads are too long for a regular toaster. For Christmas my husband bought me this four slice toaster. The first time I made egg bread toast it came out perfectly. My frozen waffles are perfect because it has a frozen setting. I think it is neat to watch the toast go down automatically. All in all I highly recommend this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wren

customer_reviews.title: Good but not durable
customer_reviews.text: This toaster lasted 8 years in daily use before one element broke completely and the other three started to weaken. The lettering rubbed off in the first and second year. We didn't use cleaners on it, but found that even rubbing the letters with your finger by accident wiped it off. So 4 stars because after the second year we had to guess which button to press. 8 years is also not a great lifespan given the cost.
customer_reviews.author: E. Torretta

customer_reviews.title: Poor product and customer service from Breville..
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of garbage. It worked fine in the first year and then intermittently it would stay on even when there was nothing in it. And now, it is on all the time, so I have to pull the plug out of socket to make sure it is off and not a fire hazard. Further, the temperature settings on this are also not working as it goes to the highest temperature. I called Breville and the representative was not helpful at all citing that it had passed its warranty period and they cannot do anything other than charge me $40 to fix it. Such a poor service for a high priced item like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after five months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last November and loved the size and that it is white. It worked beautifully until this week. Now the bread goes down and stays down no matter what I do to get it to come up. Unplugging does no good and its finally down to sticking in a fork (after unplugging it) and prying out the toast. The cancel does not work nor does the "Lift & Look" button. Not sure what I will do since some of the other reviews sort of echo my problems. We have a total Breville kitchen of small appliances and I love them all - except the toaster! so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Vibert

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this about 3 years ago. I was hesitant to pay this much for a toaster, but since it is just the two of us, we figured it would be worth it to get a good product. There has been no problem with lettering wearing off. I wash the toaster with just soap and water. Toasting is great, and we love the lift and look feature. We can fit two bagels in the toaster, two halves on each side easily. It's easy to remove the crumb trays to clean them. We found the quality of this toaster to be excellent, and it just works as it should!
customer_reviews.author: Crafts and Cats

customer_reviews.title: Just bought my last toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to spend this much for a toaster and weighed it heavily before I caved. This model was recommended by a friend who owns one. We replaced the toaster oven with this because it took up too much counter space and it just did not make good toast. My husband eats toast every day and asked for a new toaster for Father's day. This is the Cadillac of toasters! We are very happy with its performance and the quality of toast it outputs. It is pricey but I'm reconciling that with the notion it is a gift and will be the last toaster we own.
customer_reviews.author: Joan A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Makes great toast every time!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster with nice features. I like the way it slowly brings bread in and out of the slots. The slots are long enough for just about any kind of bread (round loaf), and with regular bread, it's a 4 slice toaster. I bought this one over the stainless steel version because it would be easier to clean and cost $25 less. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: LeoG49

customer_reviews.title: Fun toaster perfect toast
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best toaster we ever had. The toast is a consistent golden brown across the entire surface. We eat a lot of artisan breads that are larger than the average toaster slot and these slots are long and wide and accommodate the larger slices with room to spare. The "Little More" button is great. We make toast just to marvel at how perfectly brown each slice is. It seems to be a little pricey but if we get a couple of years out it, it will have paid for it's self considering that anything cheaper you will have to replace in less than a year anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Paula B.

customer_reviews.title: like it and would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster for a few years, use it about 4 times a week, like it and would buy it again. It takes all sizes of bread, bagels, french bread slices, etc and toasting heat is adjustable. The only reason it did not earn five starts is that it should be easier to clean crumbs from below as it has little to no access to remove crumbs via the bottom. Crumbs have to be dumped out of the top while shaking the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly catc

customer_reviews.title: Don't think it won't happen to you...'cause it will!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the concept of this toaster. There are a few flaws that others have reported and I chose to purchase anyway with the "it won't happen to me" mindset, and...it happened to me anyway. This toaster glitches. Several times in the last 6 mos. this toaster has failed to lift once the toasting cycle ended. Resetting the circuit seems to fix it...sometimes. The lettering identifying the buttons rubs off easily so do take care when cleaning the unit. It toasts beautifully and really is a nice unit. However, I feel this unit is too expensive to be having reliability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Russell

customer_reviews.title: love it but it suddenly decides to stop working!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these toasters. The first one was destroyed in a fire afer 6 months, but I had loved it so I replaced it 3 months later (after work on our kitchen). I have had this new one for about at year, and for some reason, it has suddenly stopped releasing the toast and all the lights flash. I have tried to reset it but I can't, so I guess I am out by $80 I paid for it. It is stylish and had worked well up until now (I also have other Breville appliances that I really like) but this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: origaugirl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: In heaven, there will be toasters that brown evenly...but here on earth, not so much. However, this toaster does pretty well and the bagel setting is a "real" one (using just one side of the coils, unlike my last Oster). I wanted a white toaster with 2 wide slots and didn't have a huge number of choices. I do have to rotate the slices to have them brown evenly, but that's par for the course. Fingers crossed the motor is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: FAILED in less than two years, Little replacement help from Breville
customer_reviews.text: Our Breville BTA630XL Lift and Touch failed after 22 months. The heating element on one side of one slot quit. Fortunately (Thanks Amazon!!!) I had the receipt on file at Amazon. But, Breville service said that "It is out of Warranty", as only ONE YEAR WARRANTY is provided. (Try to find that on the Amazon listing!!!) "We can offer you a 20% discount on a replacement, or a $39.00 mail-in repair...NOT EXACTLY GENEROUS for an $80 toaster that had a very brief life! Breville has a Very Poor committment of product quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality printing on toaster control panel.
customer_reviews.text: Toasts ok, but lettering on control panel rubs off over a very short period of time. We got ours for Christmas, and most of the printing is gone or unreadable. Breville says it is a cosmetic problem, and will not repair, or replace. I think for what I paid for the toaster, the lettering should be permanent. I would not buy another Breville product because of poor quality control, and reluctance of the company to take responsibility for cheap ink on printing. I highly recommend that you DO NOT purchase Breville products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster we have ever had. Finally got rid of all the toaster ovens and found this product which works beautifully. Actually toasts the bread in short period of time. Has a button which allows you to view bread to see if it is the level of toast you want, and another which toasts for "a bit more" it is also quite pretty to look at. Well done Breville!!
customer_reviews.author: taswell

customer_reviews.title: I love this toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster! This toaster does everything I've expected (from other reviews) and more! I've been looking for replacement "long slot" toaster for one that broke well over a year ago. It was so hard to find a replacement because they don't make that model anymore. The toasters currently available didn't seem to meet my needs - so many seemed just too big! This toaster isn't small but it fits well in the limited amount of space I have. The features are great giving you an LED bar the fades acting as a count-down timer. I'm so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very even toasting. Hot dog buns fit. Hamburger buns probably will fit. Nothing has stuck. It raises and lowers with the push of a button so it does not force thin slices to get stuck next to the lifting tray. The little more button and take a peek button are really nice. This is the best toaster we have ever owned in almost 45 years.
customer_reviews.author: Myron T.

customer_reviews.title: This is the Very Best toaster I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This the second one of these I have purchased. I bought the second one for my mother after her Kitchen Aid wide slice toaster just over 1yr old would not popup ( the spring mech broke). She LOVES her new toaster. The automated raise and lover system works like a champ. I can't say enough about the quality of this toaster. This is the Very Best toaster I have ever owned. By the way, I was a professional when I was younger.
customer_reviews.author: MD Holley

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster I ever had!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this about a year now, it is good quality, solidly built, and does a wonderful job. Occasionally it has required a "reboot" accomplished by unplugging it for a few minutes, but anything "smart" is going to require a reboot once in a while, that's just the way it is. We love it, would buy it again. This thing has huge slots, it accepts bagels, home baked bread, Texas Toast, you name it. Does 4 slices of regular bread at once. Adjustment works well, add a notch, you get more time. I can't find a fault with it. Aussie engineering is a winner with me!
customer_reviews.author: OPsDad

customer_reviews.title: Works great. You can put 3 regular sized english muffins ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a toaster you didn't have to push down on as I have this on a pull out shelf and wanted to avoid that pressure. Works great. You can put 3 regular sized english muffins in it. I don't use it often but my husband uses everyday. Believe me....if there was any issues I would hear about it!!!! so...his silence is a good review!
customer_reviews.author: Inky

customer_reviews.title: What a hit
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a white replacement toaster with two slice slots. We were very pleased that Breville makes their top of the line toaster in white. It seems a little lighter, mote durable and easier to keep clean than all the stainless units we looked at, including the Breville. The toasting power is fantastic, and while we usually set just below medium, the unit has plenty of power to spare. Love the features and hope we'll enjoy for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Breen

customer_reviews.title: but so far it's great! I had a narrow
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster only for a few months, but so far it's great! I had a narrow, 4 slice toaster for years and when I had to finally replace it, it was hard to find one that is narrow. It is expensive, but it works great. There is a "lift and look" feature that allows you to look at your toast and see if it is ready and then a button, "a bit more" that allows you to toast it just a little longer, without the worry of it burning. It feels solid and well made. I had ordered another brand and the metal felt very thin and I worried that it would not hold up to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Sher

customer_reviews.title: It's a great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster works great - it cooks evenly and quickly with plenty of adjustments. I really love the buttons to have a quick look (it raises the toast and then drops it back down) and to cook a little longer. It lifts the toast slowly so no more launching of cooked bread onto the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Jester

customer_reviews.title: a disappoointmeent
customer_reviews.text: purchased toaster to finally make some good toast, however was disappointed. no matter what setting,toast did not come evenally toasted. I am returning it
customer_reviews.author: VIRGINIA SMITH

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my daughter about a month ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter about a month ago. Now they are having issues with it not popping the toast back up. Alotta money to not work correctly. I did buy it refurbished from Amazon-but it still should work as advertised. I should say that I have owned a Breville toaster-same model for SE real years and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I got this and I tried it the day I got it and it worked great. The next day with a slice of bread in it it stopped working. The toast would not come up. Even after I unplugged it the toast still would not come up. Too bad because I really liked it. They have no quality control at Breville I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had many toasters over the years and I can say with no reservations that this is the best toaster made anywhere. It can toast extra long and extra wide pieces of bread, and the basket grippers actually work, holding the toast perfectly vertical so that it toasts evenly every time. I love the “little bit more” and “lift and look” features. The ONLY criticism I have is that the toast done alarm is not loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: kaloua3

customer_reviews.title: the best toaster I ever owned just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry to have to report that after 2 years, the best toaster I ever owned just stopped working. Broke my heart because it toasted evenly and was easy to use. The larger, deeper slots were much appreciated. I'm disappointed that the warranty wasn't for 3 or 4 years. I expect high end appliances like this to last longer. We are filling up our landfills with poorly made items.
customer_reviews.author: HonestTea

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps they just don't make things the way they used to. This toaster worker really well for about 10 months. Then the front coils were less efficient. We dismantled it to try and determine if there was a bad connection and found the following. There was an abundance of small connections. The metal was thin. The coils were flimsy. Overall it didn't look like it could stand up to daily use for a household of 5 once it's outer shell was off. It has been about 6 months since the dismantling project. Now only the inside coils work. Overall, very disappointing. Looked great, had handy features, but it was not build to last.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Clasby

customer_reviews.title: A Winner for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Best Toaster ever!!! It is a little on the large side, but not too large. It handles everything nicely. Frozen bread goes in hard, comes out perfect. Bagels toast to perfection. It's nice to be able to take a peak to see how something is toasting and not have to start the process all over. It is quiet, but has a sweet little bell tone to let you know your toast is perfectly done. Buy one, you won't regret your decision to spend "just a little more money" than you had planned to spend on a toaster. It's worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT - EFFICIENT, QUIET, THE BEST TOASTER I'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: THIS TOASTER SHOULD RUN FOR PRESIDENT - IT COULD DO A BETTER JOB THAN ANY OF THE CANDIDATES! AMAZING PRODUCT - SILENT AND EFFICIENT - HAS LONG/WIDE SLOTS FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF BREADS, MUFFINS, BAGELS, WAFFLES, ETC. HAS A "LOOK" BUTTON THAT ALLOWS YOU TO SEE IF IT'S BROWNING PROPERLY OR BURNING BEFORE IT'S RUINED - I CANNOT BELIEVE IT IS SO EFFICIENT. I HESITATED BUYING IT BECAUSE OF THE PRICE BUT DON'T -- IT'S THE BEST APPLIANCE I HAVE SEEN IN YEARS!
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Deal

customer_reviews.title: Toast of the Kitchen!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster I have ever owed. It was a splurge for me; I cannot imagine spending almost an extra $100 for the stainless steel version, but that's just me. One of the best features is that is handles long slices. My friends think it is cool the way the button makes the bread lower instead of the usual level. It toasts consistently and the variable darkness seems to work well. The "just a bit more" button is super! A great purchase, for me worth the extra from the $30-50 range toasters for all of the features and, again, the long slice capability. No regrets!!
customer_reviews.author: Veni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features, great looking, but perhaps a tad too powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the coolest toaster I've ever used. The mechanical lifting and dropping is really cool. Also, the "lift and look" and "a bit more" features are very nice. It's quite nice that the toaster will hold some REALLY LARGE bread slices as well. And, the toaster looks great. My only complaint is that anything more than a 2 on the doneness scale has burned my regular, store-bought sliced bread. I just have to remember to set the number low, so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: thompsjeTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Alll you need for a Toaster
customer_reviews.text: The toaster takes all sizes of bread. It has a "Lift and Look" button which is really nice. The most important part is that the settings are simple and easy to use. Very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Portenier

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a toaster with long slots - not easy to find, I can tell you! You know - for all the special loaves of bread that don't fit into a typical toaster! This toaster is nice to look at and isn't too big, as are many of the other models on the market. I love the 'quick check' feature - let's you check if the toast is done, mid-cycle. Also, the bagel feature really works - unlike my previous toaster! And finally, the 'just a bit more' button is great! Sometimes, toast needs 'just that bit more'! Overall, i am quite happy that i bought this toaster - a big improvement over my previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Balzac

customer_reviews.title: Could have been my dream toaster
customer_reviews.text: So much to love about this toaster. I can toast extra-long slices of bread. The lift and look function is great. The little bit more is wonderful when it's almost done. But with a couple of days the heating wires inside started to fail. And last night when I happened to turn off the lights while toasting I could easily see how few wires were glowing red hot. So it's going back to Amazon. So sad. Breville used to be a high-end appliance maker ($300 toasters), and apparently they haven't figured out how to get the quality right to go after the middle market. Not sure which toaster to try next.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breville warranty service was very good and they are shipped a exchange unit in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Toaster center section stopped heating after 6 months. Breville warranty service was very good and they are shipped a exchange unit in a few days. I had the same Breville toaster in 2012 that lasted 5 years before the heating elements failed.
customer_reviews.author: jho

customer_reviews.title: Center heating elements burned out after 21/2 years...
customer_reviews.text: The center heating elements burned out in the mid third year. Consequently, for the price, this was a very disappointing buy. However, before the center elements failed, the toast was reliably and uniformly toasted. But for the premature failure of the center heating elements, I would have rated this toaster 4 stars for it's features and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Coed

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster?
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster! Browns evenly, nice wide slots and you get to peek, too! It was a hit during the holidays with family staying overnight...they enjoyed using this toaster with all the different settings and were impressed by the automatic lowering and raising of toast. Entertaining and very functional. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Judy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The heat elements on this toaster (four total) failed within the first year, with one side on one slot failing within six months. It now takes up to seven minutes to toast two slices of bread, as we have to continually turn the bread around in the toaster to toast both sides. Never owned a Breville before. Someone please tell me we just got a defective model.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster for all bread sizes
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster, in fact we bought it 3 years ago and gave it to our son! We looked around at the others and decided to stick with this one for the following reasons:1) even toasting, 2) Lift and look for the perfect toasting that pulls the toast up high enough to take a good look 3) Long toasting slots which mean ANY size bread, homemade or artisan will fit 4) A bit more button for the perfect toast 5) Cool to touch outside.
customer_reviews.author: *Mary*A

customer_reviews.title: Loving this Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Have only been using this for about a week, so too soon to tell how it'll hold up over time, but for now we all love this toaster . . quite unique in it's operation and options . . . favorite (for now) among us is the 'just a bit more' button . . . how cool is that . .
customer_reviews.author: EJW

customer_reviews.title: Annoying End of Cycle Beep
customer_reviews.text: We really liked this toaster. It was stylish, worked well on toast and bagels, however is has a very annoying beep at the end of cycle, which has a frequency similar to a smoke detector, although not as loud. Unfortunately that frequency really upsets our dog, who shivers, shakes and pants for an hour.The dog has the same reaction to fireworks and smoke detectors. Contacted the factory, there is no way to turn off the beep. They did say they have had the dog complaint before and that they have a new model coming out this summer that has the option to turn off the beep. Sorry we had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Maile's Boss

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of toasters
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received this toaster as a wedding gift, loves it, and after using it once I wanted one for myself. I was tired of unevenly toasted bread, or burnt toast on temperamental toasters. The browning control slide gives you a lot of choice for your desired browning, and the "Lift and Look" button lets you check during toasting without starting the process all over again. The "A Bit More" button is a convenient way to get something toasted just a tad more. Yes, it's more costly than your Black and Decker or Proctor Silex but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A Big Dissapointment
customer_reviews.text: The more I used this toaster, the more I missed my old Hamilton Beach 2-slice model. I intended to use this for the taller slices of bread from my bread machine, but it isn't quite deep enough for slices laid on their side. Also it toasts unevenly while tending to burn the crust, even at lower settings. I also noticed the heating elements had quite a few spots that weren't glowing, and the raising/lowering mechanism starts to clog with crumbs after the first use, so it doesn't operate smoothly. Decided to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with this toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. Long ago I had a Breville and should have stuck with the brand. I can only eat gluten-free bread which must be toasted so a good toaster is important to me. I tried three less expensive brands but none had the features that this Breville has. I am totally pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen F. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster made!
customer_reviews.text: This Toaster is the Cadillac of all toaster! You get the best Price Here! Great Seller no issues at all!
customer_reviews.author: outlaw

customer_reviews.title: We tried it - we love it.
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months of use, I can not believe how much we like this toaster! It has functions that, once you have them, you will never want to give up i.e. "a little bit more" is one that we use. We rarely have issues of over-browning - only if you have a mix of very thick and very thin or a mix of kinds of bread that have different toasting speeds. This would be no different than any other toaster. I know it's expensive but - try it - you'll like it
customer_reviews.author: Double Ott Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Updated.  Downgraded from five to two stars.  One slot quit working in 2016, second in 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Feb 2013. Update 2018 & 2020. Pros: - toasts evenly - versatile; accepts either single, multiple, or oversized slices - great selection adjustments, particularly the "just a bit more" feature - looks nice Cons: - would prefer cord was white to match appliance(s), minor issue - fairly high price point, noticed others have raised durability issues, I'll see how that goes but no issues yet for me Observations: Bought Breville when my cheapo Toastmaster died shortly after purchase. I've had this almost one year now, it gets light use by one person. Left slot quit toasting in 2016, right slot died Sep 2020. Not very good mfg quality in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was a fine toaster. However
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was a fine toaster. However, 2.5 years later the center heating element no longer works and the outer heating elements are on their way out. For relatively light, weekend only use, in a 1 person household I'm not impressed with the lifespan on this $80 toaster. I managed over 8 years with much less expensive Krups. So, thank you for the service but this has been relegated to the workbench where if it can be fixed it will be donated. If it can't it will progress to the junk pile at far to early an age.
customer_reviews.author: Belgerard

customer_reviews.title: I loved this toaster until it crapped out after only 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this toaster until it crapped out after only 3 years. I expected that the lift mechanism would give out first, but no, it was the heating coil. In the center. Meaning that both sides of the unit only toasted on one side, making the whole thing useless. With so many moving parts, to have only a 1-year warranty is ridiculous. But then, it's Breville and their stuff just doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Toaster
customer_reviews.text: If your not hung up on spending a little more on a toaster than Wal Mart has, I would encourage you to try this one. Wow . . . is it impressive. It does everything but wash your dishes when your through. When my two adult daughters saw it and tried it, they fought over who was going to make the toast. So, for their birthdays, I purchased this unit for each of them. (Their birthdays are close together.) My wife makes bagels in it, frozen waffles for the grandchildren, and of course, toast. I rarely rave about my purchases, but you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Happy

customer_reviews.title: Cool features
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has some unique features that are useful. The lift and look comes in handy to see the progress of toasting and the countdown LEDs give you an idea of how much time is left. I appreciate the cool sides. Wish it had extra lift for smaller pieces of bread.
customer_reviews.author: Eyesee

customer_reviews.title: The good die young
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is pretty much perfect - the controls work smoothly, it toasts evenly, and you can fit anything in it. The lift and look feature is great and I love the "little bit more" button. (I know, it's a toaster - but having the little things right, like toast makes the world a better place) So why only 4 stars? Because a year and a half later, one side slot has pretty much failed and no longer toasts. Am I going to buy another? Yes, but at this price, the darn thing should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: K.KH

customer_reviews.title: A toaster that works!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of toasters in my life and this one is hands down the very best. My husband and I were beginning to believe there was no such thing as a good toaster anymore until we found this Breville. Not only does it actually toast bread, bagels, English muffins, etc but it actually does a good job of it. I love the efficiency and the attractive design. The price is higher than some yet totally worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: llindalu

customer_reviews.title: First use, out of the box. Not all ...
customer_reviews.text: First use, out of the box. Not all the heating "wires" light. Put it on "3 and a half" for browning. Barely browned. Put in back down and moved the browning selection to 5, and it finally browned. Takes a longgggg time to cook a piece of toast. Will try it again, but not sure I'm going to keep this one.
customer_reviews.author: dezyndiva

customer_reviews.title: How did I exist without a "little bit more" button ?
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster I've ever used. repeatable and uniform toasting. Smooth and slick operation. No latch down problems or wild spring launches as with conventional toasters and it lifts high enough to get small items out. A little pricier than a department store special, but well worth it. Seems very well built. Did I mention the "little bit more " button? Great for fine tuning your toast or reheating if you miss the done ping. (which could be a little louder.)
customer_reviews.author: rswager

customer_reviews.title: Love it ....almost 😢
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster in2012, and have fully enjoyed every aspect of it, except one....just a few months ago the words near the buttons (that tell you what the buttons do i.e.: down, a bit more, bagel...etc have literally disappeared, I wiped off with my finger what looked like a smudge but lo and behold it was the words on the toaster!. It is a bit of a bummer with a toaster that works so well would have this small yet bothersome problem!
customer_reviews.author: Tuffy

customer_reviews.title: UH - OH
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review when I first purchased this in February 2012 and now it has stopped working. I wrote to Amazon and hope someone can help me. For the cost of a reasonably high end toaster and a branded name I hope I receive customer support- it just stop working ! I am very happy with the toaster- I do not find it as large as other reviews claim it to be and I live in a NYC apartment. It is light weight and does a fine job. I do wish it had a white cord to match. A great purchase! Loaded with features and love them all.
customer_reviews.author: PUG LADY

customer_reviews.title: Color of product unsatisfactory. Not similar to my earlier purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The breville toaster arrived on 2/16 and I just opened it today 2/23. The color is not white brilliant polished surface, but almond looking dull matt surface. I want to return it, but cannot find return authorization code anywhere on the emails sent from Amazon. Please advise what to do next. Can you send a return sticket?
customer_reviews.author: Helen Canevari

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I received this toaster for Christmas, and couldn't be happier with it. The features are outstanding--especially the "lift and look" feature, and it toasts evenly every time. I looked this product up on Consumer Reports and read one review where someone complained that the inner toasting coils didn't light up. Mine appears to do the some thing, but it toasts evenly on both side of the bread every time. I'll never understand why the toasting coils don't appear evenly heated, but it works, and it works well. Ah, the mysteries of technology!
customer_reviews.author: Papillon2

customer_reviews.title: Good Toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a good toaster. This model of Breville toasts evenly and does a good job on frozen bread and will handle the more irregular shaped (non sandwich-loaf) breads. I don't say "great" because it is expensive and it is not as high quality as the toaster it replaced (an old Kitchenaid 4-slice which finally quite after 12 years). I tried a cheaper 2-slice toaster - it was junk - there are a lot of bad toasters out there - read the reviews and take the 5-star ratings with a grain of salt :) Longevity - I can only wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster I every bought. Easy to work and looks good on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The only toaster I will buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the only toaster I will buy browns evenly works great for years
customer_reviews.author: dilip korgaokar

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely the best toaster I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best toaster I've ever owned! Yes, it's a bit pricey, but you can put sliced bread, bagels, waffles, etc., and they all come out perfect. The "peek" feature is really remarkable. I use the bagel setting a lot, because it only toasts on one side. I like this for other things besides bagels, and it holds longer pieces of bread than most of the other toasters out there. The buttons are flush and part of the casing, so there are no spaces for dirt or crumbs to cause a problem. It has a pullout crumb tray, so cleaning is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomedog

customer_reviews.title: Liked it until it stopped wroking in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked this toaster although it did not brown perfectly even. However after a few weeks the last 2 times I used it the toast would not pop up and the Toast/Cancel button flashed red and did not work. I had to unplug it and dig toast out with a knife. The toast was normal size and not put in in any unusual way. I am going to have to find out if I can return through Amazon or contact the company. If it had not broken I would have given it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: HBB

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy it while it lasts...just wish it lasted LONGER!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a great toaster while it lasted~ it died after just a year and a half! :( Our last toaster (prior to this one) lasted for almost 10 years, so for the price, and the lack of longevity, I can't recommend this to friends. Bummed it didn't last longer! Nice features, but apparently it wasn't made well enough to last!
customer_reviews.author: TwinMom

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic toaster
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased what I thought were good toasters in the past, including a couple from Cuisinart, but nothing has compared to this one by Breville. I like the longer slots so you can put in slices of artisan bread without cutting them in half. There are some great features on this Breville toaster including self-lowering slots, the "a little bit more" button when you'd like slightly darker, and the "lift and look" button to check the progress of your toast. It's at a great price too for so many good features and it's a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Yachats

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a good toaster that has two long slots with all the features this one has. As soon as our previous one started showing signs of aging, we absolutely need to get one again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning this. I really liked all the features and I really liked the design. But it made terrible toast, and after all, that's why i bought it. When toasting you could look inside and see that most of the coils were not glowing red hot. This is because most of the coils were not popped out from the side like they were supposed to be, just strung tight against the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pheltnic

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I owned this toaster for 2 years prior and no issues. Just bought a replacement and it stopped working. For $80 this is not a good deal
customer_reviews.author: florence baird

customer_reviews.title: Lift and look touch toaster.
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use and accomodates those larger slices of bread that won't fit into a regular toaster. You just touch a button and the bread goes down into the toaster and comes out by itself with a little beep to let you know it's up. Also has a just a little more button that allows the bread to toast a bit longer, but not enough to burn. All in all I think this was a very worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Meggles

customer_reviews.title: not a well made product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toaster on 08.10.2013. I have used it 4 times. TODAY, 09.22.2013, it did not turn on, it is electrically dead. I have owned many toasters, from many manufacturers but never and I repeat never have I experienced such early, unexpected and complete failure of a unit. I don't want another. I give it 5 stars for appearance. I give it 0 stars for reliability.Since we take care of our belongings, this is either the result of poorly made parts, or sloppy assembly. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Toaster
customer_reviews.text: The toaster is easy to use and we love that we can put full size sliced sourdough bread and it fits!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Jr

customer_reviews.title: Toaster so far is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it every day but so far the toast comes out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LAA

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Yes -- all those buttons allowing you to customize your toasting job. But will it do the simple task of browning a single slice of bread each morning, day in, day out? I've owned this toaster for two months, and I've had no problems with it. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and toasts up to 4 slices of bread at one time. And the bagel function actually works. "The measure of a Great Nation is the ease and functionality of its toasters." -- Mahatma Gandhi. Breville has done it right.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Van Benschoten

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster - Please Make this model in black
customer_reviews.text: Love Breville products. This is a really good toaster and I am glad I spent the extra for a quality product. It does a good job toasting and I really like the lift and look feature. Wish this particular model came in black, that is the only thing I don't like about it since my kitchen is otherwise black and stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: P. Orr

customer_reviews.title: It is not worth the cost.....
customer_reviews.text: The first Breville toaster sent did not work properly, one quadrant did not operate and toast. Amazon quickly replaced the toaster, kudos for their customer service. The replacement works OK, but you have to watch it closely, even on a low setting it has a tendency to burn. The second toaster's mechanism makes A LOT of noise as well as it lowers and raises. I fear it will not last long. Highly suggest if you are looking for a toaster, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this toaster I routinely complained that the bread makers and toaster makers weren't communicating very well because a lot bread that's out there won't fit in a standard toaster. (I'm a big fan of Orowheat's rye bread, which come in long slices.) So I was thrilled to find this Breville and have not been disappointed. It toasts evenly and I really like the "bit more" feature. It also works great on English muffins and some hamburger buns too.
customer_reviews.author: Contempl8life

customer_reviews.title: The Rolls Royce
customer_reviews.text: I debated with myself for quite some time before purchasing the Breville L&L toaster. My old toaster wouldn't handle slices from my bread machine without cutting them in half. This machine handles most of them quite nicely no matter how thick or thin, oneand a half or two pound loaves. It's also fun to watch it perform. I was very pleased with the price and service from Virsib47, and from Amazon. The product arrived ahead of schedule and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Novak

customer_reviews.title: Going back. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: About a half of the little heating elements won't light up. Ridiculous. This previous review explains the problem well, and in detail:  Lovely design but lousy quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jackmin

customer_reviews.title: High-tech toaster...it'll be worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd spend $70+ bucks on a toaster...but glad I did. Who would have thought a toaster could be so sophisticated? Beautiful piece of equipment...I know it's a toaster, right?! Follow the instructions and it's seamless use!
customer_reviews.author: TrixieMaxxCloset

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac of toasters
customer_reviews.text: We are cheap skates, so couldn't believe we ended up getting such a high end toaster. But, we wanted long slots and we wanted 2 slots. This was one of the few choices that met that criteria. We have had this for a few months and have been glad we bit the bullet and spent the money. It toasts much better than our old wore out one, and the controls and features are great! At this price here is hoping it lasts 20 years:)
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome toaster! it works especially well when you have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome toaster! it works especially well when you have bread slices that are bigger than the conventional type. I LOVE the fact that it is motorized so you don't have to shove the lever down. It has so many nice features.Worth the extra price.
customer_reviews.author: cynthiab

customer_reviews.title: Lettering rubs off easily.
customer_reviews.text: I mostly like this toaster. The mechanism seems to hit the bread evenly, unlike most toasters. A negative, tho, is that it looks like some of the wires don't heat up, even tho it toasts well. However after just a few months the lettering has worn off. Others have commented on this, also. I've taped new ones on, but really on a quality product this should not happen.
customer_reviews.author: Lioness

customer_reviews.title: ... year and will now replace it with something (hopefully) better. Toasting has been inconsistent since we first got ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this toaster over a year and will now replace it with something (hopefully) better. Toasting has been inconsistent since we first got it. Nothing toasts evenly and then if you follow up with additional toasting, it comes out way darker. Today, it started going up and down on its own.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was stainless, it's white.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this thinking it was stainless, because that's what it looks like in the picture. It is actually white plastic, which looks fine but does not match my other appliances. I return to this and ordered the stainless version, and so far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not sure yet
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster for about 2 months. It seems to be well designed and made. However, it has just started having a problem with one of the elements not working. Due to the price of the toaster and the low cost of product insurance, I got the insurance, so will be asking for a refund/replacement. We would like to try another of this brand, as it seemed like a well made product. Hopefully this one is just defective.
customer_reviews.author: scccnana

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I like the physical design of this toaster - the longer/deeper shape, buttons/slider, the crumb tray. It's easy to use. However, there are a couple problems: 1) The toaster will burn both slots, even if only one is being used. 2) The button labels are coming off - the paint they used is smudging..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic toaster made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 6 year old Kitchen Aid toaster that had a broken lever. So, I reviewed dozens of toasters and decided to buy this one even though it was a little pricey. First it is oversized. So if you have a small space, this one might not be for you, but this is an exceptional product made in the USA. Love the various options: toast, frozen, bagel, and this one is great, "a little bit more" You get perfect toast every time and it lets you know when the toast is ready. It automatically lowers the bread. So, there are no levers to break. It has pversized slots for large artisanal bread. Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Cheap!! Feels heavy and looks good. However, this is an inferior product. With minimal use..... gentle use at that...this product had failed. Same problem as stated by at least one other reviewer. The central heating coils are not working after only about 15-20 uses! The result is toast that is completely under done on one side. Awful! This would be irritating if the product was sold for even $30 but, this was an $80 item.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Love it. I bit costly, but boy what a toaster. Just wanted to replace an old one and was looking for something a bit more updated. This is it. Love the check feature, you know, when you are not sure of the settings/heating on a new toaster. You can push a button and the toast pops up for a second then goes back to toasting. Well worth the dollars.
customer_reviews.author: DRicci

customer_reviews.title: A nice good looking and very functional toaster
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new toaster to replace one that had stopped heating on one surface. I like sour dough boules and it takes a very wide toaster slot to accomodate the slices. The automatic lowering and raising feature was a nice treat. Now toasting is so automatic. I also like the 'little more' button as some breads need a bit more toasting.
customer_reviews.author: Porter

customer_reviews.title: Cool toaster with poor build quality..
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster for one enjoys fancy gadgets in the kitchen. It works reasonably well with the motorized lift really cool... However, after 4 months of use now the motorized bit needs a bit of 'knocking' to get working. Maybe I got a lemon but it seems for this kind of money they really ought to use better quality materials on the key component of the design. Will likely have to send it back in a few months...fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: MaheshK

customer_reviews.title: so good. I hated my last toaster as it didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I hated my last toaster as it didn't cook evenly. Took me a few tries to find the right setting but once I found it, the toast started coming out beautifully. Each slot has cooking elements on the left and right sides and that really helps to get an even cook on both sides. The lift and look feature is handy to check how the toast is coming along. I would recommend this to anyone who has had a cheaper toaster that they hated. Happy toasting.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bodway

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster! My last toaster was a wedding gift that was 36 yrs. old! When the cord started to heat up while using I knew it was time to replace it. I wanted long slots so I can fit in sourdough bread, but also wide slots for bagels. It was well worth the price. So far every time we use it we are impressed with how perfectly our breads toast. The 'lift and look' feature is wonderful for checking on the progress of toasting.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Great features
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Breville we've purchased. The first lasted 4 years. It is a nice toaster that is quiet and browns evenly. Like the lift and look feature and the a little bit more feature. Easy to use and a lot of toasting space available.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Breville Does the Toasting Good
customer_reviews.text: Ann, my wife, had seen and used a Breville at a friend's house, so we bought one. She was absolutely correct -- wide range of settings, it takes in big slices of bread with ease (no need to cut off the crusts), handles bagels with aplomb, and has a versatile and useful set of operating options (e.g., look and see, do a bit more). Appreciated the pricing and the prompt delivery in a well protected packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Bonacer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this for a while but was waiting for a sale, I eventually gave up and ordered. So happy I did, the bread I purchase all of the time is oversized which was a problem with my old toaster, I would have to flip the bread to get all sides toasted. This works great and toasts evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Max D

product_meta.title: Breville BTA630XL Lift and Look Touch Toaster,White
product_meta.description: Motorized one-touch technology. Mechanized lowering for gentler handling. Consumer research led designers to add A Bit More browning and the Auto Lift and Look features. Bagel setting knows to toast only on the inside. Sleek, modern, premium plastic housing accents your kitchen with style. Extra-long and wide slots for artisanal breads, bagels, and pastries. Front pull-out for no-lift cleaning.
feature_bullets: Motorized carriage with push button controls
One touch motorized lift and look

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,170 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
